reviewText: The classic 1995, 6 episode series, Golden Boy is back on DVD at last. This is an echii, fan service driven show with hilarious dialogue you will be quoting forever. It's English Dub has reached cult status among fans and is much preferred to the original Japanese audio. The stories such as Kintaro's job at a high tech computer company, are really interesting and take proper work environments and situations, add a dose of craziness and perversion as well, and you've got a comedy masterpiece. My personal favorite is the job where Kintaro becomes a Swimming Instructor, even though he can't actually swim. Instead of giving up gracefully, he challenges the babe who he was trying to impress and woe, who just happens to be an ex Olympic swimmer. Kintaro ranges from eccentric genius one moment to a complete and total nut case the next minute, but in there is a good guy, with good intentions, just trying to make the world a better place.Golden Boy was animated in 1995 and the character designs, especially the gorgeous women that are the centerpiece of each episode, are simply amazing to look at and well thought out. The animation is pretty good and this release stands out better than my old 2002 DVD release from ADV. The ADV release was slightly darker and less detailed. Media Blasters re-released this and improved the encoding tremendously. Discotek, famous for their remastered releases, couldn't actually get a full remastered print from Japan, since suprisingly, this show has not been released on DVD in it's native country. Regardless, if you still have the ADV release, their simply is no excuse not to upgrade already. The Media Blaster's release is out of print and was fetching $40-$80. The fact that you can get this release for $20 or less screams bargain. I recommend picking it up now incase this new release goes out of print soon from a low print run.In Conclusion, for 180 minutes of crazy, insane laughs and classic, poetic quotes, Golden Boy should be seen by every anime fan at least once a life time, you are missing out big time otherwise. The only thing I've ever found that comes close to the thrills and craziness of this show, is a 1987 show called Junk Boy, which can be considered an 80's pilot for Golden Boy, I recommend fans check out that out now too, if you havn't done so already. I hope this review has been 'So Educational!'Grade: A
summary: Cleaner & Better Release of Golden Boy
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have both the 2007 "Remastered" DVD by Media Blasters/AnimeWorks and the 2012 Discotek DVD, and the latter is a vast improvement. Better color grading, less artifacting, and just better encoding all around. If you're wondering which DVD will yield the best quality, Discotek's is it.Just bear in mind that all they had to work with were old analog video materials since no modern masters from original film elements have been made, not even in Japan where a DVD of the series has never been released. Discotek worked with what they had and did a great job at it, and it looks nice even when upscaled to 1080p.The show is perverted and wildly comical but has heart and really is pretty carefree and almost innocent. Watch it in English. 99.8% of the time I prefer anime in its original language with subtitles, but the passionately silly English dub far outshines the original Japanese audio in both vocal performance and comedic value.Discotek are proving themselves to be one of the best anime licensers in the world, both in the material they license (largely older material, whether out of print or never released in the States) and in the quality of their video transfers, using the best sources available and touching them up when necessary. Throw money at them so that they can continue to do such a commendable job.

reviewText: *This is a copy of my original review for Goldenboy*Goldenboy is about a 25 year old student of life named Kintaro. He goes around Japan working at random part-time jobs, and loves to ride his bike.Simply put this anime is funny, no this anime is a comedy masterpiece. Kintaro always ends up getting into trouble, usually while trying to win the hearts of the various ladies he meets at his jobs.Without going into too much detail, I will say that this is probably the most hilarious anime I have ever seen. Every episode is a blast and Kintaro is just insanely amusing. Unlike most anime where the main character can start to get boring, you will end up cheering for Kintaro and he trys to learn about life.From female computer programmers to ramen cooks to even an Olympic swimmer, no woman is safe from the antics of Kintaro. You will laugh till it hurts, and then laugh some more.The main reason Goldenboy works so well is the brillant dub by ADV. Doug Smith, who voices Kintaro in English, is just perfect. He adds so much to Kintaro, that his performance rivals the icons of Japanese voice acting. When people ask which animes have better dubs than subs, you will usually find this one at the top of lists.It only has one real flaw though, it's just 6 episodes. It is painfully short, but that's something that can not be avoided. There is the manga series, but the content is so graphic it is basically pornography. That was the main reason the series is so short, some of the content was too graphic for an anime series. Otherwise it would have been dismissed as smut and not recieve the accolades this anime has recieved.While it is short, you will have a blast the entire time. It could be argued that this is one of the greatest 6-episode anime of all time. It is one of the best comedy animes of all time though, no questions asked.In the end:Is Goldenboy good? Yes it is.Is it perfect? Sadly, No it is not.Is it worth at least a purchase? YES,YES,YES!!!Pros:The animation is classic 90s at its best.The English dub is perfect.The comedy is second to none.+/-The comedy tends to revolve around perverted humor. This may turn off fans of more serious anime.Some of the episodes can be somewhat explicit(ie nudity, physical stimulation,etc). This is not for children at all.Cons:It's too short.In closing: If you want to watch a great comedy anime, check out Goldenboy. If you need an anime that will make you laugh, Goldenboy comes highly recommended.
